page.title: 01RIVER SNIZORT
page.content: The block is unpopulated except for a single croft on the eastern perimeter. Much of the area, in particular to the east og the Snizort River, which bisects the block, is rough moorland grazing. The local crofters run sheep on this grazing in a cummunal sheep 'club'. To the west of the river lie forestry plantations. These are planted in the main with non-indigenous conifers. The age of these stands vary from some 20 years old to others which are newly planted. Seperating these two areas the Snizort River runs from South to North. The river provides the main sporting centre for the area, being extensively fished for salmon. Anglers also use the small peat loch on the hill to the west of the river. The Portree to Struar Road which crosses the block in an east to west direction is a single
